version_description: When last we met you were freshly apprised of the app's stupefying power to browse Bandcamp's 1.8 million albums and 14 million tracks by any genre, and filter by format and artist location. While you were still in the hospital recovering, we added the ability to *follow* any such browsing criteria, letting you channel all new calypso from the Loire Valley on vinyl (for example) straight into your music feed. Fueling your recherché tastes has never been easier!

If you're subscribed to an artist (more info at bandcamp.com/subscriptions) and that artist publishes subscriber-exclusive video, you can now view that video right in your music feed!

You can now buy artists' merchandise directly through the Bandcamp app! Vinyl, cassettes, CDs, wax cylinders… you name it.

After three glorious years and tremendous progress with both this app and our therapists, we are finally ready to declare ourselves 2.0!

Not only is there a shiny new interface to at first hate and then get used to and then love, with 2.0 you can also:

Create an account without a prior purchase!

View your feed by new releases, fan activity and favorite genres!

Shuffle and loop your music!

Edit your fan profile!

View your followers and see who other fans follow!

View Bandcamp Daily's Album of the Day, and New & Notable records!

Every day, in every way, we’re getting better and better!

Thirty Helens agree that the newest Bandcamp app is terrific. A new messages tab unifies communications from any artists you follow or subscribe to, and the music feed smartly aggregates new releases with the activity of the fans and genres you follow. We’ve also revamped the now playing controls so that they stay out of your way but are easily summoned when you need them, even without shouting “Accio Player.” Additionally, the collection sort controls are more noticeable now (did you even know we had those?), and your settings screen has new bits and bobs that give you total control over the things you receive push notifications and emails about.

Just in time for late summer, it’s the Bandcamp Fan App spring cleaning edition! Expect faster playback startup times, more reliable collection syncing, and better behavior when you find yourself on a poor network or offline. Enjoy!

We very rarely (if ever?) call attention in this section to minor releases addressing bug fixes and crashers, but this one is pretty special. In addition to fixing a lot of those aforementioned bugs and crashers, VoiceOver support has been greatly improved, especially when it comes to navigating your collection and enjoying the music you've purchased. Please let us know if you encounter any more hiccups or have suggestions on how to further improve our VoiceOver support.
